title: AutoPlan: Automatic Planning of Interactive Decision-Making Tasks With Large Language Models. (arXiv:2305.15064v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Recent large language models (LLMs) are promising for making decisions in grounded environments. However, LLMs frequently fail in complex decision-making tasks due to the misalignment between the pre-trained knowledge in LLMs and the actual rules in the environment. Existing methods require either costly gradient computation or lengthy in-context demonstrations. In this paper, we propose AutoPlan, an approach to guide LLM-based agents to accomplish interactive decision-making tasks. AutoPlan augments the LLM prompt with a task-solving plan and optimizes it through iterative experience collection and reflection. Our experiments show that AutoPlan, though using no in-context demonstrations, achieves success rates on par with the baselines using human-written demonstrations on ALFWorld and even outperforms them by 8% on HotpotQA. The code is available at https://github.com/owaski/AutoPlan.

translated_title: 自动规划：利用大型语言模型进行交互决策任务的自动规划
translated_abstract: 最近的大型语言模型（LLM）对于在现实环境中进行决策具有很大的潜力。然而，由于LLM中预训练知识与实际环境规则之间的不匹配，LLM在复杂的决策任务中经常失败。现有的方法要么需要昂贵的梯度计算，要么需要耗时的上下文演示。在本文中，我们提出了一种名为AutoPlan的方法，用于引导基于LLM的代理完成交互式决策任务。AutoPlan通过迭代的经验收集和反思，将LLM提示与任务解决计划相结合，并进行优化。我们的实验证明，虽然未使用上下文演示，但AutoPlan在ALFWorld上实现了与人类撰写的演示基线相当的成功率，甚至在HotpotQA上超过了8%。代码可以在https://github.com/owaski/AutoPlan上找到。
tldr: 本文提出了一种名为AutoPlan的方法，利用大型语言模型（LLM）来指导代理完成复杂的交互式决策任务。通过将LLM提示与任务解决计划相结合并进行优化，AutoPlan在没有上下文演示的情况下，在ALFWorld上实现了与人类撰写的演示基线相当的成功率，并在HotpotQA上超过了8%。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method called AutoPlan, which utilizes large language models (LLMs) to guide agents in completing complex interactive decision-making tasks. By combining the LLM prompt with a task-solving plan and optimizing through iterative experience collection and reflection, AutoPlan achieves success rates on par with human-written demonstrations on ALFWorld, even outperforming them by 8% on HotpotQA without using in-context demonstrations.
